channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of leaves on the street, creating slip hazzard, 23rd December
item.description:
There's loads of dead leaves that have accumulated on the street here, which are now creating a slip hazard, but also conceal things like fox poo, which people then step on and take with them into homes (which is unhygienic). Please help!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Worlingham Road, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Provide bins on our street away from our property, to prevent dog walkers deliberately dropping their litter. This is to ensure my household are not left picking up disrespectful dog owner’s faeces and dog waste bags left outside our property., 23rd December
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Hello. I am writing to complain about dog fouling and general dog waste outside the surrounds of my property. They leave piles of dog waste bags everyday on the floor in the corner of the green telecoms box next to our wall. (Picture included to illustrate after we have tidied up the area once again!). This has gone on for over a year now and we have gone to the extent of buying “no dog fouling” labels from an online store to persuade the culprit/s to stop doing this, Yet it continues to our deep frustration. We are therefore writing to request something is done about it. Specifically, provide a bin closer in the vicinity to the property to change the behaviours of this individual/s. Also strongly worded dog signs dotted around the area emphasising that dog fouling is an offence and fines are given to those who break these rules.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
